block.p: Amy Jo Perez and Samuel David Friedlander were married yesterday evening by Rabbi Max Hausen at the Four Seasons Hotel in Philadelphia.

Mrs. Friedlander, 35, is a vice president at the Chase Manhattan Bank in Manhattan, where she manages Currency-to-go.com, which provides overnight delivery of foreign currency to travelers. She graduated cum laude from Cornell University and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. She is a daughter of Roberta and Gary Perez of Penn Valley, Pa.
Amy Jo Perez and Samuel David Friedlander were married yesterday evening by Rabbi Max Hausen at the Four Seasons Hotel in Philadelphia.

Mrs. Friedlander, 35, is a vice president at the Chase Manhattan Bank in Manhattan, where she manages Currency-to-go.com, which provides overnight delivery of foreign currency to travelers. She graduated cum laude from Cornell University and received an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. She is a daughter of Roberta and Gary Perez of Penn Valley, Pa.

Mr. Friedlander, 38, is an associate counsel of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners in Manhattan, an organization of state insurance regulators. He graduated from Skidmore College and received a law degree magna cum laude from Western New England College. He is a son of Marion Friedlander of Longmeadow, Mass., and the late Bernard Friedlander. The bridegroom is on the board of Friends of Duane Park, a nonprofit corporation that recently restored the park, at the intersection of Duane and Hudson Streets, one of the oldest in Manhattan.
